images.copyright: Amethyst laccaria mushrooms, Seabeck, Washington (© Danita Delimont/Shutterstock)
images.title: The spore the merrier
images.caption: National Mushroom Day
images.desc: Did you know there's a day just for mushrooms? Every October 15, National Mushroom Day invites us to discover their fascinating world. Take the amethyst laccaria, pictured here. Also known as the amethyst deceiver, its bright purple color is dazzling when young, but it fades with age and weathering, making it tricky to identify. Despite its delicate, ever-changing appearance, this jewel-toned fungus is edible and plays a vital role in the ecosystem.
